com.joffrey_bion.compression.huffman.semi_adaptive

Class SHCodeTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joffrey_bion.compression.huffman.semi_adaptive.SHCodeTable

  •  class SHCodeTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Huffman table, mapping each character of the source file to its Huffman code.

    Important note: if the Huffman tree corresponding to this SHCodeTable contains only a single leaf, then the Huffman code of this particular character is the empty code. Therefore, the decoder has to know the number of characters in the original file to be able to decode properly.

    Author:
    Joffrey Bion

    • Field Detail

      • table

        private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> table

    • Constructor Detail

      • SHCodeTable

        public SHCodeTable(SHTree tree)
        Builds a new Huffman table based on the given Huffman tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - The Huffman tree corresponding to the source file about to be encoded. May be null, in the case of an empty source file.

    • Method Detail

      • buildCodes

        private void buildCodes(SHTree tree,
              java.lang.String code)
        Fills the table with the Huffman codes by iterating through the given tree recursively.
        Parameters:
        tree - The current subtree to iterate through.
        code - The current code corresponding to the path from the root to the given subtree.

      • getCode

        public java.lang.String getCode(java.lang.Character c)
        Returns the Huffman code corresponding to the given Character in this table.
        Parameters:
        c - The Character to encode.
        Returns:
        The Huffman code of c, as a binary String. If c was not in the source file, it is not in this table, so null is returned. If c is the only node in the tree, then its Huffman code is the empty String: "".
